System of Equations

1.  $\dot{S} = -\beta SI + \alpha R$

2.  $\dot{I} = \beta SI - \gamma I$

3.  $\dot{R} = \gamma I - \alpha R$

Alternatively, substituting $R = 1 - S - I$:

1.  $\dot{S} = -\beta SI + \alpha(1 - S - I)$

2.  $\dot{I} = \beta SI - \gamma I$

3.  $\dot{R} = \gamma I - \alpha R$

Jacobian Matrix:

$$
J =
\begin{bmatrix}
-\beta I - \alpha & -\beta S - \alpha & \alpha \\
\beta I & \beta S - \gamma & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Disease-Free Equilibrium (DFE):

At the DFE: $I^* = 0$, $S^* = 0$
b
$$
J_{DFE} =
\begin{bmatrix}
-\alpha & -\beta - \alpha \\
0 & \beta - \gamma
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Determinant and Characteristic Equation:

$$
\det(J_{DFE} - \lambda I) = 0
$$

$$
\det
\begin{bmatrix}
-\alpha - \lambda & -\beta - \alpha \\
0 & \beta - \gamma - \lambda
\end{bmatrix}
= (-\alpha - \lambda)(\beta - \gamma - \lambda) - 0 = 0
$$

$$
(\alpha + \lambda)(\beta - \gamma - \lambda) = 0
$$

$$
\lambda_1 = -\alpha, \quad \lambda_2 = \beta - \gamma
$$

Eigenvalues and Stability of the Disease-Free Equilibrium (DFE):

From the characteristic equation:
$$
(\alpha + \lambda)(\beta - \gamma - \lambda) = 0
$$

We obtain the eigenvalues:
$$
\lambda_1 = -\alpha, \lambda_2 = \beta - \gamma
$$

Since
$$
\lambda_1 = -\alpha < 0, \lambda_2 = \beta - \gamma < 0 \iff \beta < \gamma
$$

we define the basic reproduction number:
$$
R_0 = \frac{\beta}{\gamma}
$$

Thus, the Disease-Free Equilibrium (DFE) is stable if
$$
R_0 < 1
$$
and unstable if $R_0 > 1$.

Endemic Equilibrium ($I^* > 0$):

At endemic equilibrium, where infection persists:

$$
S^* = \frac{\gamma}{\beta} = \frac{1}{R_0}, 
I^* = \frac{\alpha (1 - \frac{\gamma}{\beta})}{\gamma + \alpha}
$$

System equations:

1.  $\dot{S} = -\beta S I + \alpha (1 - S - I)$

2.  $\dot{I} = \beta S I - \gamma I = (\beta S - \gamma)I$

Jacobian Matrix at Endemic Equilibrium:

$$
J =
\begin{bmatrix}
-\beta I^* - \alpha & -\beta S^* - \alpha \\
\beta I^* & \beta S^* - \gamma
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Substituting $S^* = \frac{\gamma}{\beta}$:

$$
J =
\begin{bmatrix}
-\beta I^* - \alpha & -\gamma - \alpha \\
\beta I^* & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Characteristic Equation:

$$
\det(J - \lambda I) = 0
$$

$$
\det
\begin{bmatrix}
-\beta I^* - \alpha - \lambda & -\gamma - \alpha \\
\beta I^* & -\lambda
\end{bmatrix}
= 0
$$

$$
(-\beta I^* - \alpha - \lambda)(-\lambda) - (-\gamma - \alpha)(\beta I^*) = 0
$$

$$
(\beta I^* + \alpha + \lambda)\lambda + \beta I^*(\gamma + \alpha) = 0
$$

Therefore, the characteristic equation is:
$$
\lambda^2 + (\beta I^* + \alpha)\lambda + \beta I^*(\gamma + \alpha) = 0
$$

Eigenvalues:

$$
\lambda = 
\frac{ -(\beta I^* + \alpha) \pm 
\sqrt{(\beta I^* + \alpha)^2 - 4\beta I^*(\gamma + \alpha)} }{2}
$$

Since all parameters $\alpha, \beta, \gamma, I^* > 0$, both roots have negative real parts.  
Therefore, both eigenvalues are negative and the endemic equilibrium is stable.

DFE is stable if $R_0 < 1$;  
Endemic equilibrium is stable if $R_0 > 1$.
